On Fri, Oct 22, 2010 at 1:30 AM, Eric J. Bowman <eric@...> wro=
te:
> The problem with Accept-based conneg,
> is that you don't always have=
 control over the client -- i.e. you can't
> tell a browser to negotiate be=
tween Atom and JSON without Code on
> Demand. =A0So there needs to be some =
way to link directly to the desired
> variant, without conneg.

.. or hyper=
links that can indicate circumstantial negotiation preferences?

e.g. Brows=
ers could over-ride their default headers for the following link:

<a type=
=3D"application/json" href=3D"/foo">

thus addressing the need you've outli=
ned without being forced to treat
representations as resources or use code =
on demand.

> Among other reasons.

Please expand! :)
